This species is found in Europe and parts of Asia, inhabiting a range of grassland and open woodland habitats. The larvae of the Glanville fritillary feed on plantain (Plantago) species, and the adults are known to visit a variety of flowering plants to feed on nectar.

Melitaea cinxia is considered a relatively common and widespread species in parts of its range, though it has experienced declines in some areas due to habitat loss and fragmentation.
